projectGridLines.title: Release Engineering
projectGridLines.description:
About this opportunity

The Release Engineering Intern will work alongside the Release Manager who is responsible for driving the release management function across product and

development delivery teams involving the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and/or Program/Project Management

framework

In this role, you will...

• As an intern, you will gain valuable insight and practical skills in managing the release process, while working

alongside experienced professionals in a fast-paced and dynamic environment

• Work closely with cross-functional teams to coordinate and schedule staging environment maintenances and data

refreshes

• Assist in developing and implementing strategies for efficient and effective staging environment management

• These responsibilities will build a firm grasp of release management, agile delivery concepts, and a keen eye on

continuous improvement

• Partner with delivery and change management leadership in managing and mitigating risks regarding quality and

schedule

• Works with development and technical operations to improve the software engineering processes and practices

associated with continuously building, deploying, and updating software and environments

• Collaborate with relevant delivery teams responsible for building the automation tools used to develop and deploy

the software

• Maintain documentation related to procedures on build and release, various notifications, and dependencies

In this role, you’ll need ...

• A rising junior or senior in college pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related field

• Problem-solving mindset with the ability to troubleshoot issues quickly and effectively

• Familiarity with Mac and Linux operating systems.

• Strong understanding of OOP concepts and familiarity in at least one of the following languages: Java, Javascript,

Typescript, C#, C++

• Knowledge of relational database concepts

• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams and

functions.

• Ability to adapt to changing priorities and handle unexpected challenges with a positive attitude.
